1421139842944098307.text: May Senator Carl Levin’s memory be a blessing and may his legacy live forever on in the hearts of Michiganders, and those who he inspired.

1421139842084352005.text: Rob and I are sending all of our love and prayers to the entire Levin family, especially his wife Barbara, children, brother Sandy, and my wonderful colleague Andy Levin.

1421139841270620165.text: His confidence in me is something that I cherish and will always carry with me.

1421139840381472772.text: There is no one like Senator Carl Levin, and there will never be another like him. He was a hero to me, and so many people he worked with and inspired. I will never forget November 1, 2018, when he told a room full of people "Haley can do this."

1421139839475388416.text: Senator Levin was not one to play political games, but one to always stand up for what was right. Former Senator McCain said it best: "We all listen to him, and we listen closest to him on the occasions when we disagree with him."

1421139838468775937.text: What really stands out when thinking about Senator Levin’s legacy was the respect that he garnered across both sides of the aisle; he showed how progress can still be possible when we stick to our convictions but also insist on coming together as Americans.

1421139837487394822.text: I experienced this firsthand while serving as the Chief of Staff to the U.S. Auto Rescue Task Force; Senator Levin was one of the toughest on us, because he knew what the auto industry meant to the countless Michigan workers who relied on its success.

1421139836514279425.text: Senator Carl Levin was a giant among Michiganders, and among Congress as a whole. His 36-year tenure in the U.S. Senate was filled with not only great accomplishments, but steadfast dedication to Michigan.

1375466820287750150.text: I call on all of my colleagues in the Senate to closely examine H.R 1 to expand and protect voting rights in this country and address the attempts of racially motivated state governments to limit voting rights and access of American people in Georgia and beyond.

1347279842996322311.text: In fact, our democracy is a living mechanism in need of attention and maintenance. We must disavow those who seek to break this American tradition, and hold accountable those who wish to undermine our democracy. (5/5)

1347279839817039873.text: Too often we take for granted that our institutions keep working, and our leaders remain faithful to the American promise. (4/5)

1347279838718132239.text: Yesterday’s violent insurrection attempted to end our nation’s streak of peaceful transitions and served as a reminder to us all just how fragile democracy can be. (3/5)

1347279837661114368.text:
I served on Pres. Obama’s transition team. In this time, I worked with the public servants who preserve our democracy in the aftermath of the election.

In July, I called upon my colleagues to commit to the continued renewal & restoring of our government with each election. (2/5)

1347279836834902016.text:

1260636880888123399.text: Yesterday's teleconference was the first installment in a series of briefings we will continue to hold on the ongoing research and technology needs in the age of coronavirus, and preexisting needs that still deserve our attention.

1260636878581227520.text: As manufacturing training programs at the K-12 level have been put on hold due to COVID-19, we must find a way to engage the next generation in ongoing innovation efforts. This work is more important than ever before.

1260636876949590016.text: We must continue to strengthen our domestic manufacturing base, both in terms of capability and capacity, particularly with our workforce. We should start a manufacturing service corps to encourage the best & brightest to make, produce and generate right here in America.

1260636875414536194.text:
